body:
Hi freind,

Plz check
tts_namespace <https://github.com/mozilla/TTS/tree/master/tts_namespace>/
README.md

On Sun, Dec 1, 2019, 02:34 ng2dev <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Hello I was running these commands:
>
> docker build -t mozilla-tts .
> nvidia-docker run -it --rm -p 5002:5002 mozilla-tts
>
> and ended up with this error:
>
> File "/srv/app/server/synthesizer.py", line 8, in <module>
> from TTS.utils.audio import AudioProcessor
> ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'TTS'
>
> Why could that be and how can I fix the path/to/parent_tts ?
> Thanks
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/mozilla/TTS/issues/321?email_source=notifications&email_token=AEYAMLYKWWBIOEDHVPMBNY3QWK52RA5CNFSM4JTIAMA2YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFUVEXG43VMWVGG33NNVSW45C7NFSM4H5AUIIA>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AEYAML3UIIPYUU3WAGMKCWTQWK52RANCNFSM4JTIAMAQ>
> .
>

Thanks for the reply I had to replace your personal system specific hard coded paths in server/config.json:

 from "tts_path":"/media/erogol/data_ssd/Models/libri_tts/5049/"  
 to "tts_path":"/srv/app/tts/",  // tts model root folder

Further had to add/change these lines to the Dockerfile

COPY tts_namespace/TTS /srv/app/tts
RUN pip install -r requirements.txt -e /srv/app/tts

Luckily I found this article that explained where to download a file called  
"tts_file":"best_model.pth.tar"

It then started to actually run - though immediately terminating with this error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "server/server.py", line 14, in <module>
    synthesizer = Synthesizer(config)
  File "/srv/app/server/synthesizer.py", line 30, in __init__
    self.load_tts(self.config.tts_path, self.config.tts_file, self.config.tts_config, config.use_cuda)
  File "/srv/app/server/synthesizer.py", line 57, in load_tts
    self.tts_model.load_state_dict(cp['model'])
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 769, in load_state_dict
    self.__class__.__name__, "\n\t".join(error_msgs)))
RuntimeError: Error(s) in loading state_dict for Tacotron:
        Missing key(s) in state_dict: "encoder.prenet.layers.0.linear_layer.weight", "encoder.prenet.layers.0.linear_layer.bias", "encoder.prenet.layers.1.linear_layer.weight", "encoder.prenet.layers.1.linear_layer.bias", "decoder.prenet.layers.0.linear_layer.weight", "decoder.prenet.layers.0.linear_layer.bias", "decoder.prenet.layers.1.linear_layer.weight", "decoder.prenet.layers.1.linear_layer.bias", "decoder.attention_rnn.weight_ih", "decoder.attention_rnn.weight_hh", "decoder.attention_rnn.bias_ih", "decoder.attention_rnn.bias_hh", "decoder.attention.query_layer.linear_layer.weight", "decoder.attention.inputs_layer.linear_layer.weight", "decoder.attention.v.linear_layer.weight", "decoder.attention.v.linear_layer.bias", "decoder.attention.location_layer.location_conv.weight", "decoder.attention.location_layer.location_dense.linear_layer.weight", "last_linear.weight", "last_linear.bias". 
        Unexpected key(s) in state_dict: "encoder.prenet.layers.0.weight", "encoder.prenet.layers.0.bias", "encoder.prenet.layers.1.weight", "encoder.prenet.layers.1.bias", "decoder.attention_rnn_init.weight", "decoder.memory_init.weight", "decoder.decoder_rnn_inits.weight", "decoder.prenet.layers.0.weight", "decoder.prenet.layers.0.bias", "decoder.prenet.layers.1.weight", "decoder.prenet.layers.1.bias", "decoder.attention_rnn.rnn_cell.weight_ih", "decoder.attention_rnn.rnn_cell.weight_hh", "decoder.attention_rnn.rnn_cell.bias_ih", "decoder.attention_rnn.rnn_cell.bias_hh", "decoder.attention_rnn.alignment_model.loc_conv.1.weight", "decoder.attention_rnn.alignment_model.loc_linear.weight", "decoder.attention_rnn.alignment_model.loc_linear.bias", "decoder.attention_rnn.alignment_model.query_layer.weight", "decoder.attention_rnn.alignment_model.query_layer.bias", "decoder.attention_rnn.alignment_model.annot_layer.weight", "decoder.attention_rnn.alignment_model.annot_layer.bias", "decoder.attention_rnn.alignment_model.v.weight", "last_linear.0.weight", "last_linear.0.bias". 
        size mismatch for embedding.weight: copying a param with shape torch.Size([61, 256]) from checkpoint, the shape in current model is torch.Size([129, 256]).
        size mismatch for decoder.proj_to_mel.weight: copying a param with shape torch.Size([160, 256]) from checkpoint, the shape in current model is torch.Size([560, 256]).
        size mismatch for decoder.proj_to_mel.bias: copying a param with shape torch.Size([160]) from checkpoint, the shape in current model is torch.Size([560]).
        size mismatch for decoder.stopnet.linear.weight: copying a param with shape torch.Size([1, 416]) from checkpoint, the shape in current model is torch.Size([1, 816]).

I am not sure whats going on here. Did you ever manage to run this with docker?
Also this symbolic link on tts_namespace creates some infinite recursion in my file explorer 
as in tts_namespace/TTS/tts_namespace/TTS/tts_namespace/TTS/tts_namespace/TTS...
and so on.

Hi issuer,

I think you should check docs carefully before modify and try again step by
step.

I close this since it is not docker anymore.

> I close this since it is not docker anymore.

So is there any solution on how to get the docker container up and running, or is docker not supported anymore at all?

@ng2dev
Managed to get a working docker image by myself using a [prebuild](https://github.com/mozilla/TTS/wiki/Released-Models#simple-packaging---self-contained-package-that-runs-an-http-api-for-a-pre-trained-tts-model) model and this:
```Dockerfile
FROM pytorch/pytorch:1.0.1-cuda10.0-cudnn7-runtime

WORKDIR /srv/app

RUN apt-get update && \
	apt-get install -y libsndfile1 espeak && \
	apt-get clean && \
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* /tmp/* /var/tmp/*

COPY TTS-0.0.1+b6b513f-py3-none-any.whl /srv/app

RUN pip install TTS-0.0.1+b6b513f-py3-none-any.whl

ENV LANG C.UTF-8

CMD python3.6 -m TTS.server.server
```
